easy.text: Water boils at 100°C at sea level
easy.explanation: Water boils at 100°C (212°F) at sea level atmospheric pressure.
The Earth is spherical (oblate spheroid), not flat. This has been proven by centuries of scientific observation.

easy.text: There are 8 planets in our solar system
easy.explanation: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Pluto was reclassified as a dwarf planet in 2006.

easy.text: The sun rises in the west
easy.explanation: The sun rises in the east and sets in the west due to Earth's rotation.
Ice is the solid state of water, formed when water freezes at 0°C (32°F).
The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite and orbits our planet approximately once every 27.3 days.
Spiders have 8 legs. Insects have 6 legs.

easy.text: Humans can breathe underwater without equipment
easy.explanation: Humans need oxygen from air to breathe. We cannot extract oxygen from water like fish.
A week consists of 7 days: Monday through Sunday.

easy.text: The Great Wall of China is visible from space
easy.explanation: This is a common myth. The Great Wall is not visible from space with the naked eye.

easy.text: Lightning is hotter than the sun's surface
easy.explanation: Lightning can reach temperatures of about 30,000°C, while the sun's surface is about 5,500°C.
Gold has a higher density (19.3 g/cm³) than iron (7.87 g/cm³).
Bats can see, though many species use echolocation as their primary sense.

easy.text: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain on Earth
easy.explanation: Mount Everest is 8,849 meters (29,032 feet) above sea level, making it the tallest mountain.

easy.text: Penguins live at the North Pole
easy.explanation: Penguins live in the Southern Hemisphere, primarily Antarctica. Polar bears live at the North Pole.

medium.text: The human body has more than 200 bones at birth
medium.explanation: Babies are born with about 270 bones, which fuse together to form 206 bones in adults.

medium.text: The Amazon River is longer than the Nile River
medium.explanation: The Nile River (6,650 km) is slightly longer than the Amazon (6,400 km), though the Amazon carries more water.
Sharks are fish, not mammals. They have gills and are cold-blooded.

medium.text: The speed of light is faster than the speed of sound
medium.explanation: Light travels at 299,792,458 m/s while sound travels at about 343 m/s in air.

medium.text: The Dead Sea is actually a lake
medium.explanation: Despite its name, the Dead Sea is a salt lake bordered by Jordan and Israel.

medium.text: Antarctica is owned by multiple countries
medium.explanation: Antarctica is governed by the Antarctic Treaty System and is not owned by any single nation.
Octopuses have three hearts: two pump blood to the gills, one pumps blood to the body.

medium.text: The Internet and World Wide Web are the same thing
medium.explanation: The Internet is the infrastructure; the World Wide Web is a service that runs on the Internet.

medium.text: Tomatoes are technically fruits, not vegetables
medium.explanation: Botanically, tomatoes are fruits because they develop from flowers and contain seeds.

medium.text: The first computer programmer was a woman
medium.explanation: Ada Lovelace is considered the first computer programmer for her work in the 1840s.

medium.text: Humans only use 10% of their brain
medium.explanation: This is a myth. Humans use virtually all parts of the brain, and most of it is active most of the time.

medium.text: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France
medium.explanation: France gave the Statue of Liberty to the United States in 1886 as a gift of friendship.

hard.text: Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid
hard.explanation: The Great Pyramid was built around 2560 BC, Cleopatra lived around 30 BC, and the Moon landing was in 1969 AD.

hard.text: Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not
hard.explanation: Botanically, berries are fruits from a single flower with one ovary. Bananas qualify, strawberries don't.

hard.text: There are more possible iterations of a chess game than atoms in the observable universe
hard.explanation: The Shannon number estimates 10^120 possible chess games, while there are about 10^80 atoms in the universe.
Due to its low moisture content and acidic pH, honey can last indefinitely. 3000-year-old honey has been found edible.

hard.text: The human genome contains more genes than a grape
hard.explanation: Humans have about 20,000-25,000 genes, while grapes have about 30,000 genes.

hard.text: Scotland's national animal is a unicorn
hard.explanation: The unicorn has been Scotland's national animal since the 12th century, symbolizing purity and strength.

hard.text: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus
hard.explanation: Venus takes 243 Earth days to rotate once (a day) but only 225 Earth days to orbit the Sun (a year).

hard.text: The fingerprints of koalas are virtually indistinguishable from human fingerprints
hard.explanation: Koala fingerprints are so similar to human ones that they could theoretically contaminate crime scenes.

hard.text: The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during summer
hard.explanation: Due to thermal expansion, the iron structure expands in heat, making the tower slightly taller.

hard.text: Oxford University is older than the Aztec Empire
hard.explanation: Oxford University started teaching in 1096, while the Aztec Empire began in 1428.
